result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L Cairns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/01/2017 or penalty of 5 days Huber for non-payment.

Huber with standard release conditions to commence FORTHWITH.  May be served in Columbia County.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard L Cairns

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter dated 4/23/17 from defendant, requesting payments on his balance due of $533.00 start 6/1/17. Copy of reminder note stating $50.00 due 4/3/17, and balance due by 4/17/17, attached.  **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 5/2/17 - Approved. Amend JOC to have pay plan start 6-1-17 and send copy to business center**

ADDRESS INFO for Richard L Cairns
Current: 1160 Oakview Drive #10, Saint Charles, MN 55972 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2016)
Prior: 400 Dewitt Street, C/O Columbia County Jail, Portage, WI 53901 United States

Defendant Richard L Cairns in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reads criminal complaint.   Formal reading waived.  NOT GUILTY plea entered.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Defendant is bound over for trial.  Information filed.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1

Sentence of:
90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).   Consecutive.  Commences immediately. May be served in Columbia County. 

COSTS:  $268.00

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/1/2017. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 5 days in Huber 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
